Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: Alansilverfox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here and used it as a base for visiting Rome as we did not want to stay in central Rome. The hotel is located on the sea front and we were lucky enough to get a room with sea view and a small balcony which was lovely. The room was a decent size but definitely only 3 star. All staff we met were great as was breakfast. The hotel is 10 minute walk to the train station the 35 minutes into central Rome, all for 2 euros each return. Good shopping & restaurants right on the doorstep Overall an adequate convenient place to stay with no frills & reasonable value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Art Deco Hotel -”
Reviews.Author: geswho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week before a cruise - wonderful atmosphere, excellent location, excellent staff. Breakfast was lovely with the best cappuccinos we have ever had!! Location absolutely excellent - would go to stay for a few weeks or month. Walking distance to Roman Ruins - excellent restaurants. Very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel close to beach & airport”
Reviews.Author: Karen_and_R0n
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Belvedere Century in Ostia for the last couple of days of our Rome trip. It was very convenient to the airport and the hotel arranged a car to get us to our flight in time. The manager was very helpful in recommending restaurants. The seafood is wonderful in this town. Delightful square with shops. The hotel is over a bar & there was a really loud band our last night there. Two hours of sleep before our flight.

Reviews.Title: “Great Italian location by the beach.”
Reviews.Author: bergenmann
Reviews.Content: Very friendly English speaking staff, very good continental breakfast. Bathrooms need updating otherwise functional.

Reviews.Title: “just a step up from a dive”
Reviews.Author: sezmjc
Reviews.Content: I had read some good reviews about this place, and needed a place for one night near the airport. Boy was I disappointed. It is not a dive--but it is just a hair above. There were big smudge marks on the walls of out room, and the tile floor was not really well cleaned; the air conditioner barely worked; there were no instructions for the TV, and the station guide did not match the stations; no one answers when you call the desk from your room...so you have to walk down stairs if you want something like a wake up call. On the good side, it was relatively quite, nd the sheets were clean. The pictures of nude women on the walls of the hall kind of makes you wonder if they might not rent the rooms by the hour... not my cup of tea. And, don;t be fooled by the 'rooms have a view' notes, most don't..indeed our room looked out to an air shaft. You have to pay extra fro internet service--and it is pretty slow. For $100 Euros you can do much better.

Reviews.Title: “This is the hotel to stay in”
Reviews.Author: terrytraveler13
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself have recently returned from a visit to Rome where we stayed in this hotel. The hotel is on the seafront and about 30 mins from the city. The hotel was very clean, the staff were very helpful and all reception staff spoke English. The waitresess in the breakfast room spoke a little English but it was enough to understand. Breakfasts were a good continental buffet' from 06.00 - 10.00hrs. Half board can be arranged prior to arrival and the evening meal is served at a restaurant across the road on the beach. The restaurant bills the hotel at a set price but the food is excellent, and the staff are very friendly but speak very little English. The one small fault we found was the pillows are very thin and as we had been forwarned we took inflatable pillows but there was one extra good pillow and we did not worry about asking for another one as we had our inflatable ones. The beds were very good. Clean towels every day but they were linen and not towelling although they were just as good for drying. Free safe in rooms for which you set your own security number. To go into Rome the station is about 10mins walk and it is best to buy a 4euro ticket which lasts until 23.59hrs and can be used on any bus,tram or train in the urban district of Rome as many times as you wish all day. Ostia Antica is two stops up the line and is well worth a visit but needs a good day to see all, it is like Pompei but not covered in ash. There are plenty of shops about with a Carrefore near the station. In all we found this hotel good in all respects. Although there is a bar next door the noise was not bad enough to worry us. We found this a very agreable hotel and place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for last night in Italy”
Reviews.Author: chagallvoyage
Reviews.Content: This was our last night in Italy, this hotel provides a Shuttle to the airport for 6 euros, which was great and efficient. The room are fine, clean and yes it is a 3 star hotel so you can't expect the Ritz but I've seen much worse 3 stars in Europe and USA. The rooms on the 3rd floor are better as the floors are ceramic tiles, you can hear people walking above you (a little). Also, there are 2 nice terraces for guests located on the 3rd floor. Take advantage of the breakfast in the morning, especially the coffee, made by a nice girl. No they do not serve eggs and bacon but this is Italy so Croissants and coffee, yogourt, juices... The location is perfect, also above a nice microbrewry.

Reviews.Title: “Belvedere Century is a beautiful hotel with a sincere hospitality and scenes of serenity”
Reviews.Author: Shaltoot
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location with a beautiful sea view. Also, it is considered close to Rome's Airport. It has a very friendly and very much co-operating staff. Also, the free internet is great. However, you must locate at the lobby to access the internet. Furthermore, "how to reach?" directions listed on the site are not sufficient and I took a risk to reach the hotel from Rome's Fuimucino Airport. Italian citizens were great those speaks English and those not! They need to include much intuitive directions, including landmarks and fool-proof instructions for non-Italian speakers. At the end, you will love the people, shopping, sea, caffes and more of this very quiet and tranquillising city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother - shady place - relatively cheap BUT terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: dolphinmarine
Reviews.Content: Seriously - if Motel 6 is 10 - this is a 4. Pros: - Relatively in-expensive for Rome - Great Pizzeria nearby (pizza by the pound - try the pumpkin flower pizza!!) - Real Hot-Water in shower, good-pressure !! - Mario (shuttle driver - great guy!) - 20 mins to airport week-day morning. Cons: - Terrible Room (Cheesy, Rusted hardware, Fittings falling Off - too many to mention!) - Toilet was temperamental(may/may-not flush) - Mosquito menace (couldn't kill 50+) - Internet only works near front-desk (of-course never mentioned anywhere) - 12" TV (really 12" !!) didn't work (wanted to watch World-Cup Soccer) - Don't have decent words to describe bathroom (lets not go there !)

Reviews.Title: “Old and rustic but does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Kara07
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in Ostia because my partner has friends there. It was a great contrast to the hustle and bustle of tourist Rome and the 'Eat and Go' restaurant across from the hotel was great value. The hotel has seen brighter days (it was built in the hey day of Italian 'Hollywood') but is in a great location in the centre of the seafront. I had read the reviews but said to my partner 'as long as the rooms were clean, I'd be happy'; and they were. Big enough, double glazed patio door which helped to keep the little bit of street noise out and clean throughout, I was happy. The towels were a bit thin but I didn't mind as I had my own. The shower was very small indeed but again 'did what it said on the tin'. The staff on reception were friendly enough and the rooms had free wi-fi albeit intermittent. We stopped for five nights and I can honestly say that so long as you're not expecting the Hilton, this hotel is a perfect bargain and suitably comfortable. It's a five minute walk to the station and hey, you're in Rome! The hotel is just somewhere to lay your head and get a shower. If you want more, put your hand in your pocket!

Reviews.Title: “Awful! There must be better near the Airport”
Reviews.Author: ssmhawaii
Reviews.Content: Late afternoon checkin for early am flight from Rome (FCO). Didn't do much research and didn't want to pay for 4 rooms at the Hilton Airport. Found Lido di Ostea on line and the Belvedere seemed to have location in the city center and beach front going for it. MISTAKE. What a dump. Rooms smelled, ac was poor on a hot August day, towels looked like thin recycled table cloths, wall thin....you get the idea. Beaches are jammed and all infront private, requiring aroung 10 euro for entry, towel, chair, per person with card from hotel. Advice...such it up and pay for the Hilton (since nothing in this town looked reasonable) or get up early and enjoy another magical night in the great city of Rome.
